intro: Trichelostylis autumnalis, commonly known as the autumn spike rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in late summer to autumn. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as wetlands and forest floors. Trichelostylis autumnalis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
